title: Senior Product Manager, Workspace, Google Cloud
location: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada
description: At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day. In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative developers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users. In this role, you'll revolutionize user interactions within Google Workspace and harness the transformative potential of GenAI. With a keen focus on leveraging GenAI tools like Gemini and Vertex AI, you'll craft seamless and intuitive experiences across Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Drive, and beyond, enhancing collaboration and empowering hybrid teams. You'll delve into customer pain points, steer a multi-year roadmap, and foster close collaboration with Developing and UX teams to pioneer AI-driven features that redefine productivity at its core. Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
key_qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in product management or related technical role.
3 years of experience taking technical products from conception to launch.
preferred_qualifications:
Experience creating product roadmap(s) from conception to launch, driving the product outlook, defining the GTM strategy, and leading design discussions.
Experience with UX/User Experience.
responsibilities:
Define the product outlook and execute the strategy for Generative AI in Workspace.
Design and lead a multi­-year roadmap, balancing short­ and long­-term goals and investments to scale globally.
Own cross-functional product development process from ideation through development and commercial launch, collaborating with multiple internal, executive, and external teams to ensure coordination throughout product development, fostering and facilitating timely decision-making, driving product and delivering success.
Engage regularly as a trusted advisor with customers to understand their communication strategies, pain points, and priorities to inform product strategy, while providing transparency into roadmaps and managing expectations.
Partner closely with Development, UX, and other internal Google teams to drive product and delivery success.
